definitions.definition: A molecule in which a sugar group (the glycone) is bound to a non-sugar group (the corresponding aglycone ) by a nitrogen or oxygen atom. Glycosides yield a sugar after undergoing hydrolysis .

main_definition: ( organic chemistry , biochemistry ) A molecule in which a sugar group (the glycone) is bound to a non-sugar group (the corresponding aglycone ) by a nitrogen or oxygen atom. Glycosides yield a sugar after undergoing hydrolysis .
